edge: In preparing for her role in the film, Sally Hawkins watched films featuring silent comedians such as Charlie Chaplin, Buster Keaton, Harold Lloyd, and Stan Laurel from Laurel and Hardy, which Del Toro suggested because he thought Laurel could 'do a state of grace without conveying it verbally'.
Del Toro wrote the script with Sally Hawkins in mind for the female lead and pitched the idea to her while he was intoxicated at the 2014 Golden Globes.
The exterior of the building is the façade of the Victorian Massey Hall, a performing arts theatre not far from the other one.
